alert.note: Alert for Bath; Fleming; Menifee; Montgomery; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 9:51PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kentucky, including the following counties, Bath, Fleming, Menifee, Montgomery and Rowan. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 951 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Morehead, Owingsville, Marshall, Salt Lick, Olympia, Polksville, Olympia Springs, Peasticks, Bourbon Furnace, Craigs, Young Springs, Moore`s Ferry, Preston, Crooks, Sudith, Midland, Kendall Springs, Ramey, Farmers and Hope. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
